611 (SixEleven) (Symbol: SIL) is a decentralized peer-to-peer digital coin and a Bitcoin software Namecoin's branch. If a name is registered successfully, no one can take it away consent. Users can connect and release data with it which everybody can ensure is originated from them but which can not both be forged and censored by unauthorized attackers. Despite Namecoin, the data users associate and publish with their 611 name(s) are available around the world by any device connected to the Internet resolving the name.611.to.611 (SixEleven)'s flagship employ case is the anonymous second level domain .611.to, which is functionally like .com or .net domains.

Octocoin (Symbol: 888) is an innovative payment system employing peer-to-peer technology with no intervention from central banks. Based on the Bitcoin Protocol, the Octocoin currency system allows instant payments to anyone from any place in the world. The 'network' is a vast international interconnect of Octocoin peer nodes, which carries out collectively transactions and minting. The Octocoin Foundation is a strong base of volunteers who share the vision of a future where anyone can freely transact with whomever they please. Octocoin was initiated on BTC Talk on Mar 08, 2014 at 18:08 (UTC) and later abandoned by it's the original developer of the same name. On Nov 11, 2015, a new developer stepped up and released an updated client, thus reviving Octocoin.

Dogecoin (Symbol: DOGE) is a digital token emphasizing a picture of the Shiba Inu dog from the Doge Internet meme as its logo. Remembered as a "joke currency" on 8 December 2013, Dogecoin's online association is rapidly extended and obtained a capitalization of US$60 million in January 2014. As of June 2017, the capitalization is about US$340 million. Compared to other cryptocurrencies, the original token creation of Dogecoin is faster. By mid-2015, 100 billion tokens have been used in transmission with an extra 5.256 billion token annually after that. As of 30 June 2015, the number of mined Dogecoin was 100 billion. The coin has gained traction as an Internet tipping platform, in which social media users give Dogecoin rewards to other users for sharing unique or remarkable information.

Zcash (Symbol: ZEC) is a virtual token which is similar to Bitcoin but with some different practicalities. Like Bitcoin, Zcash employs a distributed blockchain; however, it presents anonymous specialties, by hiding the amounts of transaction and parties associated. In Bitcoin, users' operations can be tracked if someone knows their address, then all the involved addresses and their exchanged amount are viewed. It means that the amount of tokens moving around is accessible to the public. ZCash encrypts all the information concerning the amount and involved parties. It applies a distinctive proof to secure the Zk-SNARK network security or proof construction. This mechanism allows the platform to manage a bound ledger of balances without establishing parties or swapped volumes included in transactions.

BitShares (Symbol: BTS) is a primary distributed multi-user database with update allowances which is managed by a defined set of rules and public key cryptography. The BitShares Software is an open source that is straightforward to copy and transform, and most significantly protected by free speech. That’s the reason why BitShares cannot stop at the layer short of a worldwide event that ruins almost all digital data. The government utilizes the cryptographic software to work as a weapon and impose export controls. However eventually, the government cannot handle the expanse of free BitShares software which is in the Public Domain.

Published in 2013, DigiByte (Symbol: DGB) is a public source virtual token serving on the DigiByte Blockchain, a decentralized worldwide blockchain. DigiByte is a Bitcoin-based token; however, it has developed in functions, containing 15-second block time and upgraded security. On January 10, 2014, the first Digibyte block was mined. It has one of the longest free blockchains. Generating DigiByte, programmer and entrepreneur Jared Tate aims at establishing a high-speed and protected virtual token that could reach a broader and more distributed association than Bitcoin. There was a premine to repay developers and early adopters. DigiByte built asymmetrical difficulty adjustment mining with DigiShield, that is a widely used technology and the structure of many other decentralized blockchains. It is also the first token to change from a single Proof-of-Work (PoW) algorithm to multi-algorithm mining.

BitcoinDark (Symbol: BTCD) is an innovative digital currency system that tries to overcome many of the difficulties from the present world of economics. Although bitcoin established foundation for many other cryptocurrencies, many of these including bitcoin itself have become seriously concentrated through corporate interests and reliance on infrastructure-heavy Proof-of-Work (PoW) mining. BitcoinDark is designed based on a Proof-of-Stake (PoS) mechanism that is both secure and resistant to attack from centralization. Moreover, this coin can ensure anonymity and real-time exchange.

Peercoin (Symbol: PPC) is a virtual token using both Proof-of-Stake and Proof-of-Work systems. A paper launched in August 2012 reported that Peercoin was produced by Scott Nadal and Sunny King, an alias of the creator of Primecoin. Since November 2013, King has been as Peercoin's sole core developer after Nadal had no longer involved in the growth of Peercoin.  Bitcoin inspired Peercoin, so Peercoin has a variety of the source code and technological execution of bitcoin. The MIT/X11 software license is responsible for the distribution of Peercoin source code.  Different from all bitcoin, Namecoin, and Litecoin, Peercoin does not have a hard limit on the number of possible coins. Nevertheless, it is designed to achieve a yearly inflation rate of 1% ultimately.

While the second generation was adjusted to Power-of-Stake (PoS) mechanism, the third generation is employing the Virtual-Power-of-Work (VPoW) mechanism. For China, both are unique innovations. YB coin is a Chinese clone of YACcoin which applies scrypt N+1 and ChaCha. The crypto has a quite low block time of 60 seconds but being a clone has not brought much to the table regarding innovation. Again similar to Yacoin, there is a dynamically adjusted economic model related to the system power that balances the incentivization to mine and utilizes it relying on its popularity and this is called inverse relationship.

Similar to Bitcoin, Kobocoin (Symbol: KOBO) is a cryptocurrency and payment system with an African heritage. All nodes verify transactions in a public decentralized ledger called the blockchain. The ledger utilizes its unit of account, also called Kobocoin(s). The Kobocoin blockchain is decentralized, to independently verify the chain of ownership of every Kobocoin amount. The wallet on users' device is a node which runs to secure the security and integrity of the blockchain together with all other nodes. There is no central database. This is the distributed nature of the Kobocoin ecosystem. In the Kobocoin ecosystem, every participant who holds a funded wallet becomes a stakeholder. This entitles them to freshly minted Kobocoins as a reward for contributing to maintaining the integrity of the blockchain. Stakeholders are rewarded with freshly minted Kobocoins until the full allocation is in circulation. From then on, all rewards will be based on the transaction fees produced within the ecosystem.

PetroDollar (Symbol: XPD), as a peer-to-peer cryptocurrency, is established to deflate with relation to the world crude oils reserves, with approximate 1:10,000 relationship to barrels of oil still existing in the ground. Hence, this creates an analogy of the USD/OIL trading pair. Every transaction(Tx) broadcast over the PetroDollar system will be required a transaction fee to be destroyed autonomously in line with oil depletion. The currency has a current fee of 1.429% of the amount transmitted, developing to approximately 15% in 2045. PetroDollar developers reserve the right to re-evaluate future destruction patterns to adapt them to real-world oil market dynamics as history unfolds. Appropriate statistical references and computations which shall be given will justify all changes from the base design.

With GEOCOINS, users are allowed to encrypt virtual GEOCOINS send short, personal and receive messages. Regarding technical aspect, cryptographic proof-of-work offers a real-time peer network of transaction verification, a "public book" synchronized numbers and unique chances for math-based puzzles to peer. GEO collect only go through on the surface of the earth to a place. This is done by users' geographic coordinate tracking, as they move with their cellphone.

To have a signature for transactions, the development team uses compact representation is used. In contrast to Bitcoin, SpreadCoin eliminates the copy of the public key directly from the mark. Created in June 2013, Argentum (Symbol: ARG) is a rare, secure, and unique coin with the scalable, distributed, censorship-resistant, immutable blockchains. Argentum is considered as a rare commodity because it is not only easily and quickly transferable but also gains value over time. The innovation doesn't end there as Argentum is the first digital coin to improve transaction processing capabilities over those of Bitcoin. The purpose of Argentum is to become the first encryption currency with almost unlimited scalability. Argentum has 10MB max block size, and 100,000 signature operations per block. Even more exciting, the latest update allows Scrypt and SHA256D mining with AUXPOW support. The team wants Argentum to be a long-term stable investment and attempts to give an alternative for people who would like to have diversification in less risky digital coin. The coin has the block time of 45 seconds on average, and it is fully confirmed every 4.5 minutes. 64 Million Argentums will be mined; when this limit is reached, it is increased by 1.1% annually - the average rate of human population growth.

Aricoin (Symbol: ARI) is a a digital currency descended from Bitcoin. Unlike Bitcoin it does not use SHA256 as its proof of work (POW). Aricoin employs a simplified variant of scrypt much like Litecoin. The goal of the Aricoin Project is to make cryptocurrency accessible to everyone. Aricoin enables instant payments to anyone, anywhere. The Aricoin Network uses peer-to-peer technology to operate with no central authority: managing transactions and issuing money are carried out collectively by the network. The Aricoin Network is the name of open source software which enables the use of this currency. The Aricoin Project is a collective of developers who share the same vision - making cryptocurrency accessible to everyone.

Auroracoin (Symbol: AUR) is a virtual currency that removes the involvement of present banking system and has its self-sufficient value. Different from traditional currencies, Auroracoin is decentralized. The supply of this coin is stable, which can make the price of the currency increase and reduce the inflation.

Betacoin (Symbol: BET) is an open and decentralized cryptocurrency. Anyone interested can join its network and take part in currency development. As well as the Internet, this crypto is international by its nature, and allows safe and secure transactions around the globe and offers the convenience of instant fee-free money transactions. In order to distinguish betacoin network from betacoin currency, the latter is referred to as BET. For instance, current betacoin's emission rate is 65,000 BET every 120 seconds.

BitBean (Symbol: BITB) is a new digital currency designed for scale-capacity, speed and lightning-fast transactions. It features an innovative proof-of-proportion (Po) algorithm and closely conventional Proof-of-Work (PoW) similar to other currencies. BitBean is the first crypto used to implement 20MB blocks Gavin Andersen proposals that are based on Bitcoin-scale ability to address limitations. SHA-256 ASIC mining saves energy, so it is chosen as the algorithm for the pow period. After initial distribution of 10,000 blocks to which that was mined all over the world BitBean a pure POS virtual currency. Po was active during the PoW mining period, and about one-third of those 10,000 were released Blocks evidence shareholding blocks. The number of existing BitBeans is still limited in comparison with the maximum limit of 50 billion BitBeans that are yet to be generated with pure Po. BitBean has no premine; it requires to mature 6 hours for beans before they are entitled to one block to the game. Moreover, unlike other POS digital currencies, BitBean adds new blocks an approach similar PoW crypto use currencies. Each block Po rewards 1,000 virtual beans; this is a much better form of PoS to determine as rewards based on a percentage basis. BitBean the Po is a payment system that encourages people to process transactions rather than hoards their coins. Hoarding coins and only the processing of transactions rarely collect an interest payment, do not for a bank wire.

BlueCoin (Symbol: BLU) is a peer-to-peer Proof-of-Stake (PoS) velocity virtual money. The initial Proof-of-Work (PoW) mining distribution period lasts 50,000 Blocks. The initial mining period is followed by a transition into an energy efficient Proof-of-Stake (POS) Velocity algorithm. This will provides balance holders on the network a 5% staking annual interest. BlueCoin employs a cold-staking algorithm which enables BLU holders to obtain interest while their money is stored safely offline. Bluetooth activities make sure that payments are processed even when there’s no Internet connection! Cold staking guarantees that the coin's holders are paid interest for their assistance of the network without ever needing to endanger their holdings.

BlackCoin (Symbol: BLK) is a Peer-to-Peer digital currency with a decentralized, open ledger. Also, BlackCoin is open-source and utterly available for public inspection. The transaction history is also stored in the blockchain which is shared commonly. Working as a bank but more than a conventional bank, BlackCoin is completely clear. There is a limitation of the number of coins making it worthy and a good store of wealth. Only the networks can create new coins with 1% interest rate. Users' account generates 1% interest per year to help maintain the system security. The network of peers handles all the ability to conduct transactions and create extra BlackCoins. In other words, the banks are controlled by the distributed network. Though a mechanism called staking, Blackcoin owner can receive a 1% yearly interest.

BoostCoin (Symbol: BOST) is the first global Proof-of-Work/Proof-of-Stake hybrid coin employing the X13 algorithm. Proof-of-Stake helps BoostCoin to be a stable and reliable system. Founded in July 2016, BoostCoin Limited's main business is automated Bitcoin trading. They deliver services in investment funds management to private investors and provide the guaranteed high income. BoostCoin Limited concentrates on the placement of investment funds in the biddings by digital currency funds in the largest world cryptocurrency exchanges. The team is a group of many web specialists tied together by the common faith in cryptocurrencies. Their purpose is to provide everybody with the opportunity to access the Bitcoin and earn profit easily with their system.

Moon coin (Symbol: MOON) is a Proof-of-Work digital currency that offers a fast, simple, reliable and transparent exchange. Max coins supply is 385,000,000,000 MOON based on average distance from the Earth to the Moon. Block time of this coin is 90 Seconds with difficulty retargeting every 8 hours. Adjusted for micro-payments and available for everyone. All transactions are secured developed by our unique algorithm for three years and are constantly tuned for optimal performance. The main blockchain is equipped with the future in mind, which allows innovative ideas to take and implement them quickly and reliably.

Zetacoin (Symbol: ZET) is a distributed public-source clone of Bitcoin featuring high-speed transactions and high-speed challenge adjustment. Released in 2013, Zetacoin takes advantages of the conventional Bitcoin's SHA256 code and innovative technologies to increase the transfer speed. The coin is usually confirmed within 30 seconds which is a good choice for swift, smaller, day-to-day trading. More important, Zetacoin is inflationary. The primary circulating supply of 160 million Zetacoins is increased with a further one million coins/year, making up for lost coins and maintaining the growing demand for Zetacoin. Zetacoin was not pre-mined at launch and is therefore considered as a fair-mined digital money.

By employing the original powers of virtual tokens and blockchains, the currency's purpose is presenting a system for communities, organizations, and individuals to established energy applications. Furthermore, Energycoin is expected to promote the so-called Energy Transition and the escape from fossil fuels towards local generation and renewable energy.

As a fork of the Bitcoin project, Riecoin (Symbol: RIC) is a distributed, open-source cryptocurrency that allows the users to transfer money to anywhere around the globe. Moreover, this coin requires the minimum transaction fees; sometimes no money depending on lots of things such as the amount of transfer and the network load at the moment of the transaction. The name "Riecoin" pays honor to Bernhard Riemann, whose work created new ways of studying the allocation of prime numbers and is referenced in the math of Riecoin. Also, it pays homage to Bitcoin, the digital currency that originated them all. 
Riecoin has some following characteristics:
- The RPC API and the peer-to-peer protocol are extremely like iBitcoin's JSON API and Bitcoin's protocol respectively. 
- Only the network command has changed significatively. It currently returns the full data to hash; the customers have to hash, find a nonce and embed it in the data. Please see the source code of customer or the external miner for reference.
- The meaning of gethashespersec and the challenge in getmininginfo have changed.
- Getblocktemplate had small changes. The achievements do not exist anymore, and except when the trailing zeros are less than 256 (see the PoW explanation), the nonce range is always the full 256 bits of the nonce field now.
- The block header has changed. Timestamps are 64 bits, and there are 256 bits for the nonce.
- The number of the protocol's hardcoded version is up to 10070001, and the number of protocol's "magic" is 0xdbb2bcfc, and 0x0511090d for testnet.

CannabisCoin (Symbol: CANN) is a distributed, peer-to-peer, open-source virtual currency from Bitcoin and Peercoin in May 2014. It was created to be a payment solution for Marijuana's pharmacies, retailers, and merchants, thanks to marijuana everywhere. Technically accepted, the coin is proof that the crypto conferencing employs the X11 asynchronous algorithm and the Kimoto gravity engine to adjust the mining challenge. The sum of coin payment is limited to 92 million. Magazines are specially designed and cultivated by "CannabisCoin Marijuana Cultivators." Thanks to CannabisCoins, it is easier to trade specific strains of Marijuana.

Bottlecaps (Symbol: CAP) is a digital currency that functions on the scrypt algorithm with no intervention from any central authority keeping track of every transaction within the system. Being a peer-to-peer, open source cryptocurrency, Bottlecaps provides a block reward of 10 coins, and its system will produce a total of 47,433,600 coins after nine years. If users want to get started mining and trading this alternative digital token, they need a Bottlecaps wallet. A wallet client is available for them to download and install on their computers. The Bottlecaps price/value can be considered weak in spite of the upward trend of its exchange rate. In effect, this digital currency experiences instability in its exchange rate because it suffers from high fluctuations.

CryptoCash (Symbol: CASH) (market ticker CASH), also known as CashCoin or digital cash, is a coin with the similar application and uses to Bitcoin; however, Cryptocash deploys some updated characteristics. The team who built CASH determined to grow on the Bitcoin (BTC) algorithms and create something unique and sustainable. Bitcoin is well known, Litecoin and DogeCoin are two of the many alternative digital coins which are in their formative stages. In CASH, there are two types of mining, including proof-of-work (PoW) and proof-of-stake (PoS). The PoW minting rate is controlled by Moore's Law, which dictates that the ability in PoW grows exponentially. The PoS minting introduces a maximum 10% annual inflation. CASH transaction (tx) fees are removed against inflation. Therefore, overall the CASH minting design is still very low inflation when comparing to Bitcoin. Dissimilar to Bitcoin and many other alternative coins, CASH does not have a fixed coin supply cap. There is a 47,433,600 coin maximum value in the source code, but that is only used for consistency checking and is not meant to be part of the mining design.

Catcoin (Symbol: CAT) is released on December 24th, 2013 as a scrypt version of Bitcoin with only 21 million coins mined at 50 coins per 10-minute blocks. The team is an open community that expects to use peer to peer technology to support the lives of cats and their humans. Catcoin is a version of Litecoin employing scrypt as a Proof-of-Work (PoW) algorithm. However, this system has the same blockchain parameters as Bitcoin. Catcoin has following features:
- 50 coins per block
- 10 minutes block targets
- Subsidy halves in 210k blocks
- 21 million total coins
- 36 blocks to retarget difficulty

Cannacoin (Symbol: CCN) is another coin attempting to associate itself with the narcotics business. The block reward halves every year and difficulty retargets utilizing the kimoto gravity well. The currency is Scrypt with the block time of 60 seconds, and the total supply is capped at 13.14 million. CannaCoin runs on a distributed blockchain network like Bitcoin enabling participants to send money across the network within seconds. This distributed platform is the independent of any central authority and follows the basic principles set forth by the Bitcoin community. Global climate change is an essential issue. Fortunately, there’s now an innovative organization under the name "The GreenCoin Foundation" which is a nonprofit to help people track their carbon savings and then reward them with Greencoin (Symbol: GRE), a cryptocurrency like Bitcoin. GreenCoin is easy to use. It runs by incenting the hard work performed by renewable producers. For instance, a person who currently has a PV solar system on their home could gain GreenCoins freely. PV solar array owners, an example of renewable asset owners, do useful work with the purpose of alleviating climate change which currently has no additional incentive or reward. More specifically, they generate electrical energy at a reduced carbon output when compared to the average amount of carbon released by the global electrical production effort. This creates a carbon offset for which a benefit is constructed. The asset owners report their production daily to the GreenCoin Foundation. The amount of carbon savings which the owner has produced is calculated by the processing of the information. GreenCoins are decentralized directly to all of the asset owners reporting for that day in relative proportion to their carbon saving efforts by the Foundation.

The purpose of Woodcoin is to deal with a problem existing with the supply economics of various public money. The reward schedule either drops too quickly or too slowly. Woodcoin’s reward drop is a harmonic series, which more closely models renewable resources rather than non-renewable. Therefore, while it is always better to chop LOGs today than tomorrow, there will still always be an incentive to protect the network tomorrow. The logarithmic money supply curve is created for stability and longevity, with the longest reward schedule of any other digital coin. Half the LOGs will be issued in the first 200 years. Moreover, every block is worth less than the preceding one - so earlier adopters are always rewarded.

Prismchain (Symbol: PRM) is a javascript-based blockchain programming environment designed to make developing decentralized applications (DAPPS) more user-friendly. PRISM uses javascript in a couple ways that they say are critical to supporting decentralized computing:

+ More user-friendly, because many people know how to code in javascript. The current system of legal contracting relies on a group of technical experts (lawyers); PRISM hopes to avoid making specialized developers the new necessary technical experts.
+ Better support for objections and permissions. In a blockchain supporting DAPPS, users are sharing and running programs, which themselves might need to reference others’ programs. Their javascript language gives users control over who can reference their code and under what circumstances.
The team also say that they will implement three blockchains. The first is dedicated to transactions. The second is dedicated to apps, data storage, and data transfer. The third provides a customised nameregistrar system, url redirecting to DAPPS addresses and other web layer functionalities.

GoldBlocks (Symbol: GB) is a distributed, open-source digital currency which is forked from BlackCoin in May 2016. The coin is a hybrid Proof-of-Work/Proof-of-stake (PoW/PoS) coin which can be either "mined" by a computer or "minted" by a process called "staking." The coin's PoW part employs the X11 hashing algorithm including blake, bmw, groestl, jh, keccak, skein, luffa, cubehash, shavite, simd and echo with the block time of 60 seconds and a total coin supply of 24.7 million. The PoS method of GoldBlocks provides a 10% annual interest on staked coins, with the total supply capped at 50 million coins.

Anoncoin (Symbol: ANC) is a cryptocurrency promoting the privacy and anonymity for its users. Created in June 2013, Anoncoin was the first crypto supported for the I2P darknet to make sure that the IP address of the user is untraceable. Additionally, the support of Tor makes it impossible to determine ANC user's location and keeps their internet traffic private. The coin system is maintained by distributed miners who process transactions into blocks that are added to the public blockchain network. Each block created is followed by the creation of a specific amount of Anoncoin that is rewarded to the decentralized miner. Anoncoin will be released with a limited amount of approximately 3.1 million coins, that is about seven times less than the Bitcoin cryptocurrency. The team attempts to modify the difficulty of the Scrypt Proof-of-Work (PoW) to guarantee that a block is created about every 3 minutes.

Byteball (Symbol: GBYTE) is a distributed platform allowing tamper-proof storage of arbitrary data, including data that denotes an interchangeable value such as money, house titles, debt, shares and so on. Storage units are closely associated with each other so that each storage unit comprises one or more hashes of earlier storage units, serving to both confirm previous units and establish their partial order. The links among units set a DAG (directed acyclic graph). No single central entity manages or coordinates admission of new units into the database; anyone can add a new unit if they sign it and pay an amount of equivalent money to the size of added data in bytes. The fee is gathered by other customers who later confirm the new unit by holding its hash in their units. When new units are added, each earlier unit receives more and more confirmations by later units with its hash directly or indirectly.

vSlice Token (Symbol: VSL) is a Meta-Token designed on Ethereum network and is ensured by its system of miners in the global. The token represents a piece of the ownership of the vDice gambling app together with its revenue. It will release dividends generated by the gambling fees charged on vDice, which is a wholly distributed version of SatoshiDICE for Ether betting. vSlice is a profit-sharing meta-token on the public Ethereum Blockchain which contains a series of interlocking Ethereum Smart Contracts. Therefore, it directly shares profits from the voice game system to token owners. For token holders, there are periods called 'epochs'. In the first 25 days of an epoch, the Smart Contract is unlocked, and tokens can be traded. And in the last five days, the smart contract is locked. At that time, token holders can draw their reward from the games. After that, the next epoch occurs and so on. vSlice token owners can get a share of profits from any other games. The distributed profits are from the games on the voice system; this is accomplished by arranging the house Address of those contracts to the profit Container's address. The way to distribute the profits depends on the number of tokens that an owner has in proportion to the total supply, and the amount of profit included in the profit Container contract at the beginning of lock period.

Like cash, with AvonCoin, users are allowed to remain anonymous while executing transactions. The anonymization technology makes it impossible to identify the identity of the transferer. An external blockchain is employed as the controller of the system, manages access control, identities and serves as a tamper-proof log of events. YesCoin (Symbol: YES) is a PoW/PoS scrypt digital currency with an 88% return in staking rewards. YEScoin's proof-of-stake system connects randomization with the concept of "coinage," a number derived from the product of the number of coins times the number of days the coins have been held. If the crypto has been unspent for at least 30 days, they start competing for the next block. Older and larger sets of coins have a higher probability of signing the next block. This process guarantees the network and gradually generates new coins over time without consuming significant computational power. This makes a malicious attack on the system more difficult because there is a lack of a need for centralized mining pools and purchasing more than half of the crypto is likely more expensive than acquiring 51% of proof-of-work hashing power.

Dai is a virtual currency that has an automatic reaction to new market conditions to maintain its value against the major world currencies. Dai is designed by the Dai Stablecoin System, a distributed system that operates on the Ethereum blockchain network. With Dai, anybody can freely select a reliable currency which has stable purchasing power. Maker (Symbol: MKR), is a distributed autonomous organization on the Ethereum blockchain network attempting to decrease the price volatility of its durable coin — the Dai — against the IMF’s international currency basket SDR. The producer is an intelligent contract system on Ethereum that backs and maintains Dai's value via a dynamic network of Collateralized Debt Positions (CDPs), independent feedback mechanisms, and suitably incentivized external actors. Maker allows users to leverage their Ethereum assets to generate Dai on the Maker System. Once created, users can employ Dai in the same way as any other virtual currency: it can be freely transferred to others, manipulated as payments for goods and services, or held as long-term savings. Importantly, Dai's generation also produces the elements needed for a robust distributed margin trading system.

Tezos (Symbol: XTZ) is a newly decentralized blockchain that governs itself by establishing a digital commonwealth. It facilitates formal verification, a technique which mathematically proves the correctness of the code governing transactions and boosts the security of the most sensitive or financially weighted smart contracts. Tezos takes a fundamentally different approach by creating governance rules for stakeholders to approve of protocol upgrades that are then automatically deployed on the network. When a developer proposes a protocol upgrade, they can attach an invoice to be paid out to their address upon approval and inclusion of their update. This approach provides a strong incentive for participation in the Tezos core development and further decentralizes the maintenance of the network. It compensates developers with tokens that have immediate value rather than forcing them to seek corporate sponsorships, foundation salaries, or work for Internet fame alone.
Tezos instantiates new technical innovations but also enforces types of constitutionalism through the use of formal proofs to mathematically verify that critical properties are upheld over time. By allowing stakeholders to coordinate on-chain, the network also provides bounties to implement specific features or discover bugs. Collectively, the system maintains the decentralized aspect of blockchains while introducing a mechanism to enable collective decision making. Tezos tokens not only control smart contracts in the network but also allow votes on protocol amendments. The initial Tezos rollout is simple by design, but its self-amending nature refers to the improved rules governing rules over time.

NVO (Symbol: NVST) distributed exchange is run through two elements. The first one is a multi-digital currency open source wallet in which all keys are built locally on the device of users and never given to any server. Users control their private keys, send and receive funds, export wallet, and encrypt the wallet with a password or seed phrase. Developers can evolve and add new assets via an open plugins platform maintaining the wallet lightweight. The second element is a validator hosted on the Safenetwork. Users will link to the Safenetwork through the wallet to trade. An application will suit the orders released by the users and check all transactions and order information are valid. Different from distributed and semi-distributed exchanges, there isn’t a wallet acting as a relay. Transactions are processed at the same time through an order matching engine from one wallet to another. The validator on the Safenetwork will examine whether the activities are valid or not before being traded. The sequences are then suited and transactions broadcasted in their respective networks. The validator process raw business exchange and doesn’t keep any private keys or assets nor can it sign transactions resulting in a trustless distributed exchange employed the Safenetwork to validate orders.

Decryption keys and file hashes are accepted to be stored immutably on the Opus smart contract. Monetha (Symbol: MTH) is an Ethereum-based decentralized trust and reputation platform that facilitates trusted commerce and eliminates the complexity of existing systems by using smart contract. The core decentralized trust and reputation system (DTRS) works with Monetha’s payment processor via smart contracts. The information to ensure a trustful relationship between selling and buying parties (for example, warranty) will be logged onto the blockchain. The smart contracts in the system revise each party's trust rating according to a predefined algorithm by evaluating the quality of the transaction. Based on the data recorded from the past transactions, clients and merchants will be able to resolve a claim, view ratings, rate each other, etc. Their history is then saved onto the permanent Ethereum blockchain so that next clients or merchants can be well-informed before any commercial decisions. Filecoin (Symbol: FIL) is a decentralized digital currency which is similar to Bitcoin except for the design. While Bitcoin only employs Proof-of-Work, Filecoin features the Proof-of-Retrievability element. Although this element can benefit users, it demands a particular file to be stored in nodes. The platform creates an entirely decentralized file storage system with the maximized storage capacity of data. 
Similar to Bitcoin, with the support of blockchain, Filecoin adopts a transaction ledger. In this blockchain, each block must be followed by a Proof-of-Work (PoW) on the basis of a cryptographic hash function. As in Bitcoin, the PoW parameter is adapted so that one block occurs within every ten minutes. Further, as in most blockchain-based constructions, transactions should only be committed after a sequence of some valid blocks, where several blocks are defined by the given restrictions on the power of the adversary.

The atomic world and the byte world are connected to promote the interaction and circulation of assets between two worlds. ATLANT (Symbol: ATL) operates as a custom decentralized system, governed by the DAO family built on Ethereum. The platform is powered by its core token, abbreviated as “ATL”. ATL tokens are essentially membership certificates in the ATLANT Platform, which give the following rights and privileges to their owners: 
- Stake in all properties listed on the ATLANT Platform during their initial property token offerings. The platform enables property owners and developers to tokenize property by creating customized smart contracts and perform a token distribution to either sell the property (partially or completely) or attract financing for its construction. The size of the stake is initially set at 7% of the underlying asset and, subsequently, determined by voting of the ATL token holders. After a successful token sale, an agreed part of the property tokens is released out of ATLANT escrow to ATL token holders proportionately. 
- Commissions from P2P rentals are imposed on the lessor, as a small fee, once a transaction with the lessee is finalized. These commissions are distributed to the ATL token holders. The size of this fee is determined by voting of the ATL token holders.
- Votes to decide various actions taken concerning the property: platform listing decision, listing fee approval, law firm choice, management company choice (property tokenization), property for rent approval, rental fee approval. 
- Ability to work, and earn extra income, within the framework of ATLANT as an arbiter for conflict resolution in P2P rentals, moderated via an arbiter rating system. As a result of this work funds withheld from the escrow of the losing party are distributed to the ATL coin holder who performed the arbitration
- Influence on the platform and ability to propose, vote on and aid further developments to improve the efficiency of real estate globally, as well as boost ATLANT’s global adoption and growth.

BlakeStar (Symbol: BLAS) is a cryptocurrency with a focus on high performance, longevity, and adoption by services. BlakeStar is one of the first cryptocurrencies to use the Blake2s hashing algorithm. Blake2s itself is a high speed optimized cryptographic hashing algorithm used for Proof-of-Work and Proof-of-Stake hashes in BlakeStar for performance with low load. BlakeStar uses Proof-of-Work, but unlike Bitcoin, it is configured to transition to Proof-of-Stake, when small numbers of coins are issued yearly for staking. Staking will be 10% per year. The advantage of transitioning to Proof-of-Stake is to avoid the centralized mining pools that may eventually threaten Bitcoin with a 51% attack. Most Bitcoin mining has been centralized in China, which is not necessarily a good thing for the currency. Proof-of-Stake is known to discourage centralized mining pools. This makes BlakeStar ideally suited for dedicated staking devices and low-power/low-spec systems. Originally dependent on the "libb2" library version of the Blake2s reference distribution, the blake2s reference implementation has now been directly baked in for ease of compilation across platforms. Users no longer need to download and install libb2 separately.

+ Anonymous
+ No premine or dev taxes
+ Store of value: Proof-of-Work (POW)
+ Fully decentralized cryptocurrency
+ Decentralized development
+ Decentralized mining
+ Easy to mine: Equihash algorithm

AirSwap (Symbol: AST) is a decentralized token exchange based on the Swap protocol whitepaper. Swap provides a decentralized trading solution based on a peer-to-peer design. The design solves two problems encountered in a peer-to-peer trading environment: counterparty discovery and pricing suggestions. AirSwap core services include a searchable index of traders with “intent to trade” and a pricing oracle. For those looking to trade ERC20 tokens, the Index will be a destination to advertise that you’d like to trade and to search for others looking to trade. Once matched, traders connect and interact directly. To assist with the pricing process, the Oracle provides pricing suggestions, generated from multiple data sources. Once agreed on the price, one trader makes an order and the second takes and submits the order to an Ethereum smart contract for settlement.

Ethbet (Symbol: EBET) is a decentralized, peer-to-peer, and provably-fair Ethereum-based dicing game without a mandatory house edge. Ethbet can offer bets without a house edge because players bet directly against other players instead of against a centralized house. The disadvantage of this is that in order to place a bet, there must be another party willing to place the same bet. For this reason, it is possible that a player must wait for their desired bet to take place, especially if it is tremendous. An additional feature of an optional player-defined house edge is added, allowing players to offer and take (‘call’) bets with any house edge that they desire. Thus, a player that prioritizes speed over their expected return can agree to a bet that gives him a slight disadvantage (i.e. a bet that gives his opponent a small house edge). Similarly, a player that is patient and prioritizes their expected return can offer bets that the formerly mentioned player may choose to call. This results in a model where players are effectively able to become their own casinos, allowing market forces to provide players with bets as quickly as possible at the best possible rates. The Ethbet protocol features an efficient off-chain matchmaking relay in order to allow players to quickly and cheaply communicate their intent. The protocol can also be extended to support betting using any Ethereum-based (ERC20) token and for use with other games.

UpToken (Symbol: UP) is a reward for our ATM customers. Coinme uses 1% of every ATM transaction to purchase UpToken, which is given to customers as a 1% “cash back” reward. The customer can use their UpToken to receive a 30% discount on ATM fees by paying with UpToken. However, the UpToken that is rewarded to ATM users through using the ATM is not available for withdrawal until that user has reached $10,000 in ATM volume. Additionally, Coinme will periodically hold auctions to determine which cryptocurrencies should be added to Coinme ATMs (currently Coinme only supports bitcoin, and ethereum is going to be added soon). These auctions will require UpToken to participate. We do not discriminate against which protocol ultimately wins – we want to have a huge network of ATMs ready to support the big coin of the future, and the boosters of that coin will need UpToken to secure their spot on our network. These auctions will be held as often as will provide maximum benefit to the UpToken community and ATM customers. We plan to hold the first auction immediately after the token sale (once we have sent the UpTokens).

Developers work in their trees; then when they think their characteristics or bug fix is ready, they submit pull requests. If there is broad agreement that it is a good thing, the patch will be accepted. If there are any the incompatibility with the project's coding conventions or the controversy, developers should rework and resubmit patches. The master branch is usually made and examined but is not warranted to be totally stable. Tags are frequently designed to indicate new stable release versions of Aerium. Feature branches are designed when several individuals are performing major new features. Sometimes a pull request will become antiquated. If this happens, and the pull is no longer automatically mergeable; a comment on the pull will be used to declare a warning of closure. The pull will be closed 15 days after the warning if the author doesn't take action. Pull requests closed in this manner will own their corresponding issue labeled 'stagnant'. Issues with no commits will be granted a similar warning and closed after 15 days from their last activity. Matters closed in this manner will be labeled 'stale'.

The open-source RChain (Symbol: RHOC) project is building a decentralized, economic, censorship-resistant, public compute infrastructure and blockchain. It will host and execute programs popularly referred to as “smart contracts.” It will be trustworthy, scalable, concurrent, with proof-of-stake consensus and content delivery. Using smart contracts, a broad array of fully-scalable decentralized applications (dApps) can be built on the top of this platform. DApps may address areas such as identity, tokens, timestamping, financial services, monetized content delivery, Decentralized Autonomous Organizations (DAOs), exchanges, reputation, private social networks, marketplaces, and many more. The RChain Network implements direct node-to-node communication where each node runs the RChain platform and a set of dApps on the top of it. The heart of an RChain is the Rho Virtual Machine (RhoVM) Execution Environment, which runs multiple RhoVMs that are each executing a smart contract. These execute concurrently are multi-threaded. This concurrency which is designed around on the formal models of mobile process calculi, along with an application of compositional namespaces, allows for what are in effect multiple blockchains per node. This multi-chain, independently executing virtual machine instances is in sharp contrast to a “global compute” design which constrains transactions to be executed sequentially, on a single virtual machine. Also, each node can be configured to subscribe to and process the namespaces (blockchains) in which it is interested. Like other blockchains, achieving consensus across nodes on the state of the blockchain is essential. RChain’s protocol for replication and consensus is called Casper and is a proof-of-stake protocol. Similar to Ethereum, a contract starts out in one state, many nodes receive a signed transaction, and then their RhoVM instances execute that contract to its next state. An array of node operators, or “bonded validators” apply the consensus algorithm to crypto-economically verify that the entire history of state configurations and state transitions, of the RhoVM instance, are accurately replicated in a distributed data store. The blockchain contracts (aka smart contracts, processes, or programs), including system contracts included in the installation, are written in the RChain general-purpose language “Rholang” (Reflective higher-order language). Derived from the rho-calculus computational formalism, Rholang supports internal programmatic concurrency. It formally expresses the communication and coordination of many processes executing in parallel composition. Rholang naturally accommodates industry trends in code mobility, reactive/monadic API’s, parallelism, asynchronicity, and behavioral types.

Telcoin (Symbol: TEL) is a new cryptocurrency based on the Ethereum blockchain that will be distributed by your national telecom operator and made available to everyone, anytime, anywhere. This is the core of our business, and mobile network operators will be at the center of our strategy. Telcoin is the first cryptocurrency to tap into synergies between the reach of mobile telecoms and the fast, borderless nature of blockchain technology. According to the World Bank, there are nearly five times as many mobile phones in the world (5 billion), as there are active bank accounts (1.2 billion). It's a lot easier to access mobile phone services than banking services, and we aim to capitalize on that disparity. We will initially offer Telcoin to our mobile network partners, providing their customers with seamless access to the digital economy: online remittances, transfers, payments, and ecommerce. We will also provide the necessary marketing and product development resources to nurture the Telcoin ecosystem, in a joint effort with our telecom partners. Our objective is not to compete with telecom mobile money, but to cooperatively participate in the overall mobile money ecosystem. We see ourselves as a complementary solution; a tool that will increasingly bring users to mobile money, cryptocurrency-backed solutions, and mobile wallets. Our goal is to become one of the cornerstone financial inclusion efforts of the 21st century and we want to cooperate with actors who we believe can play a critical role in this process, namely mobile network operators.

Devery (Symbol: EVE) is an open-source protocol for verification services on the Ethereum network. Devery.io is developing the Devery Protocol, a decentralized verification platform that enables marking and tracking over the Ethereum network. The protocol allows manufacturers, brands, retailers and any other party to assign unique signatures to any products, services or digital goods sold, issued and traded online. The unique signatures are stored on the Ethereum network and can be queried to determine contextual data (including location, date, manufacturer/point-of-origin and the identification of the verifying party). Similar to ZEC, ZenCash utilizes zero-knowledge proofs and its Equihash Proof of Stake (PoS) mining to provide private transactions. However, it has no founder's reward. ZenCash's distributed, and encrypted networking framework is resistant to traffic correlation and metadata analysis.

Skeincoin (Symbol: SKC) is a cryptographic token employing the Skein hashing algorithm. People combine it with SHA256 hashing as Proof of Work. Skeincoin hashing is quick, and people implement it for CPU, GPU, FGPA, and ASIC. The Skeincoin in itself is like bitcoin but employs a new Proof of Work (POW) algorithm that is energy efficient, secure and faster. More for less! The first round of hashing is done utilizing Skein, the second utilizing SHA256 (Skein-SHA2). Accordingly, there is no limitation for CPU and GPU implementation, and the coin is perfectly appropriate for FPGA and ASIC.

Imagine a fully integrated system across the entire supply chain, from the moment a shipment leaves the factory, to the final delivery on the customer's doorstep; federated in trustless, transparent blockchain contracts. This is ShipChain (Symbol: SHIP). The ShipChain platform is based on a simple, yet powerful solution called "Track and Trace." The ecosystem will encompass all methods of freight, and will include an open API architecture that can integrate with existing freight management software. The ShipChain platform unifies shipment tracking on the Ethereum blockchain, using a sidechain to track individual encrypted geographic waypoints across each smart contract. With this system, the meaning of each cryptographic waypoint is only accessible for interpretation by the parties involved in the shipment itself. This gives shippers more visibility across their supply chain, and allows carriers to communicate with ease.

NewYorkCoin (Symbol: NYC) has a very similar story to Bitcoin. The original developer of NewYorkCoin GitHub nycoin/nycoin disappeared at launch on March 6, 2014, which just happened to be the same year that Hal Finney died. The original code and GitHub account for NewYorkCoin has never been accessed since creation. A New York Coin Foundation member stumbled across NewYorkCoin (NYC) as a new scrypt miner in early 2014 with no response from emails sent, dead links on the original website (nycoin.net), incorrect coin data published, etc. This scrypt coin miner grew up in New York City with deep family roots in the Big Apple and felt an obligation not to enable this coin representing New York to fade away. This early coin miner founded the NEW YORK COIN FOUNDATION in 2014 to guarantee that accurate coin info was issued, the NYC block explorer is run smoothly, and NewYorkCoin wallets are sync with the system.

The rupee (Symbol: RUP) is the common name for the tokens of India, Indonesia, Maldives, Mauritius, Nepal, Pakistan, Seychelles, Sri Lanka, and formerly those of Afghanistan, Tibet, Burma and British East Africa, German East Africa and Trucial States. In the Maldives, the unit of coin is known as the Rufiyah, a cognate of the Sanskrit rupya. The Indian rupees and Pakistani rupees (₨) are subdivided into one hundred paise (singular paisa) or pice. The Mauritian and Sri Lankan rupees subdivide into 100 cents. The Nepalese rupee subdivides into one hundred paisas (both singular and plural) or four sukas or two mohors. RUPEE is a digital currency utilizing a distributed system of computers to validate and secure exchange of value. Rupee allows users send and receive of digital payments immediately and 100% securely due to the use of Rupees peer-to-peer network. A proof-of-stake type of the currency is the base for the Rupee payments networks.

Genstake (Symbol: G3N) utilizes a natural reward halving system, cutting the supply that is released through the pos/pow system by half every year. There is a hard limit of 15m coins written into the code, but depending on the balance between POW and POS over the years, there's unlikely to be more than 13M coins. Genstake aims to firmly put the future of the coin in strong hands while attempting always to leave the door open for anyone to get involved with the coin through traditional means. Who can compete with POW when the monsterous hash is being thrown at a coin? There's almost no way into a valued pure POW coin these days without spending a serious amount of money on hardware. And for POW/POS coins, so much hash goes into the POW phase that the only way to get in is to get lucky right at the beginning before the difficulty grows too large. With Genstake, hopefully, once the initial dust settles it will become a coin that is accessible to everyone, and because of its inherent value to stake-mine itself it will be mostly kept off of the market and held by strong hands that will support the network indefinitely. Coins that do find their way onto the market will only give others more staking power on the network and enable others the opportunity to generate more coins for themselves.

StakeNet (Symbol: XSN) is the world’s first Trustless Proof of Stake (TPoS) coin that allows users to safely, and conveniently stake their XSN coins in cold wallet storage using Ledger hardware wallets. Owners of XSN will be able to stake their coins effortlessly by setting up a contract with a merchain, allowing the merchant to stake the owner’s coins without the need for total control over the coins. Along with TPoS tech, XSN will implement other new features like Lightning Network, Atomic Swaps, Masternodes Enhanced Privacy and the innovative Cross Chain Proof of Stake (CCPoS) feature. The block rewards for XSN are split between masternodes, staking nodes, and treasury. Masternodes will receive 45% of the block rewards for providing high bandwidth, 24/7 connections, which provides basic requirements for further XSN features. Staking rewards, whether that be from TPoS or regular PoS, will also receive 45% of the block rewards for leaving their nodes online securing the network. Lastly, 10% of the block rewards will go to the treasury as an extra fund for future developments of XSN and various other factors for XSN.

The AbjCoin (Symbol: ABJ) is a cryptocurrency built upon blockchain, which is underpinned by the Proof-of-work (POW)/ proof of stake (POS) consensus mechanism. The POW is similar to Proof-of-stake (POS) with the main difference being that it integrates behavior trusted to be positive for the entire economy, while POS derives importance from the user‘s account balance. AbjCoin algorithm is that of Proof-of-Stake (POS) because it does not require large-scale computing resources for maintaining the Blockchain. The ABJ COIN network emphasizes security and trust-less computing. The AbjCoin blockchain employs a system of nodes operating together in a p2p configuration. The nodes record and verify transactions that are transmitted on the network. At block time (periodic intervals), these operations are grouped together and then go through a hashing process that connects them to previous blocks. The network’s participants are anonymous, and there is no restriction on their caliber.

BiblePay (Symbol: BBP) is a secure deflationary blockchain developed to benefit those in distress. 10% of the emission of the blockchain goes directly to sponsoring Orphans, with provable contributions, contributed to an organization (Compassion.com) that is more than 75% efficient. Proof of Work has been replaced with Proof Of Biblehash (POB) - an algorithm that compensates full nodes participation, while preventing GPUs and ASIC by requiring full blockchain transaction referencing in the hashing function, along with chained bible verses. This means biblepay subsidizes full nodes that stay online. Seven-minute block targets minimize the blockchain file size, yet BiblePay supports Dash's instant send for speedy transactions. MasterNodes (called Sanctuaries) will come online after Christmas, allowing all expenses to be voted on and approved.

The EOSIO (Symbol: EOSDAC) Software  being developed by Block.one will facilitate the first highly scalable smart contract blockchains, with transaction fees covered through small levels of token inflation. This will allow the development of genuinely scalable decentralised applications, and online/onblock businesses which can be owned by their communities. Instead of ‘mining’ on the Proof-of-Work algorithm like Bitcoin and Ethereum, EOSIO blockchains will use the Delegated Proof of Stake algorithm, whereby token holders vote in 21 main block producers and 100 reserve producers. These block producers will require major infrastructure to handle enterprise class decentralised applications and will need to be significant entities capable of scaling as required. Block producers will be paid through the limited inflation of EOS tokens in circulation.

Monero is not a company but a platform formed by engineers and researchers of cryptography and decentralized networking from all over the world. Technical specifications 
- Algorithm: Scrypt  
- Max coins: 500,000,000,000
- Block time: 60 seconds
- Difficulty retarget: 10 minutes

ODYSSEY (Symbol: OCN) is a revolutionary mission against current centralized sharing economy to build one decentralized sharing economy and peer to peer ecosystem.

The sharing economy has been rapidly emerged as a large and expanding force. This is powered by declining transaction costs. Smartphones, internet connectivity, and the cloud allow consumers to efficiently search for their desired goods and services, understand the terms, ensure timely logistics, and enforce the agreed- upon contract. Formerly frustrating transactions have become hassle-less.

In the future, sharing will become the norm and ownership will be a luxury. You may own nothing but you can simply share everything. You can adjust your expenses flexibly in accordance with the demand. You purchase something that you actually need instead of spending more. Sharing will also enable utilization of spare resource and increase the overall income and welfare of the society.

This sort of sharing economy enables us to convert the deal of property ownership into deal of right & use. Basically, it is a realization of the “on-demand” deal which highly increases the efficiency to use assets and services, and simultaneously, reduces the overall cost.

Intense (Symbol: ITNS) is the fuel and operating currency for the peer-to-peer (P2P) decentralized VPN. It is based on the CryptoNote technology and uses the exclusive CryptoNight algorithm. Bitcoin (Symbol: BTC) is a global digital currency and peer-to-peer payment system designed by an unknown programmer, or a group of programmers called Satoshi Nakamoto. It was issued as open-source software network in 2009. The interface is a digital system and transactions which are verified by network nodes and recorded in a peer-to-peer blockchain network, occur between customers directly without an intermediary. Bitcoin is known as the first decentralized digital currency as the progression of the platform doesn't include a central repository or single administrator. The purposes of bitcoin are to make a reward for mining and exchange bitcoin for other currencies, products, and services in both legal and illegal way. Until February 2015, the number of merchants and vendors employing bitcoin as payment was over 100,000. Research produced by Cambridge University in 2017 revealed that most of 2.9 to 5.8 million unique people utilizing a virtual currency wallet use bitcoin.
